class.name: FmodListener3D
class.brief_description: A 3D audio listener node for FMOD spatial audio.
class.description:
FmodListener3D represents a 3D audio listener for FMOD's spatial audio system. It defines where the "ears" are located in 3D space, affecting how positioned audio from [FmodEventEmitter3D] nodes is heard.
FMOD supports up to 8 simultaneous listeners, which can be useful for split-screen games or complex audio scenarios. Each listener has an index (0-7) and a weight that determines how much influence it has on the final audio mix.
The listener automatically tracks its node's position, rotation, and velocity, providing realistic 3D audio spatialization including: - Distance attenuation - Directional audio based on orientation - Doppler effects from velocity - Occlusion and obstruction (when configured in FMOD Studio)
When the node is removed from the scene tree, it automatically unregisters itself from the FMOD system.
Key features: - Automatic 3D position, rotation, and velocity tracking - Support for multiple listeners with weighted mixing - Listener locking to prevent position updates - Integration with FMOD's 3D spatialization system - Doppler effect support through velocity calculation

method.name: get_listener_index
method.description: Returns the index of this listener (0-7). Each listener must have a unique index.

method.name: get_listener_weight
method.description: Returns the weight of this listener. Higher weights give the listener more influence on the audio mix when multiple listeners are active.

method.name: get_locked
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the listener is locked and won't update its position automatically.

method.name: set_listener_index
method.description: Sets the index of this listener (0-7). Each listener must have a unique index. Changing the index will unregister the old listener and register a new one.

method.name: set_listener_weight
method.description: Sets the weight of this listener. Higher weights give the listener more influence on the audio mix. Typical values are between 0.0 and 1.0.

method.name: set_locked
method.description: Locks or unlocks the listener. When locked, the listener's position won't be updated automatically, allowing manual control through [FmodServer].

members.member: The index of this listener (0-7). Each listener in the scene must have a unique index. Multiple listeners can be used for split-screen games or complex audio scenarios.
The weight of this listener when multiple listeners are active. Higher weights give more influence to this listener's position in the final audio mix.
If [code]true[/code], the listener's position is locked and won't be automatically updated from the node's transform. Use this when you want manual control over listener positioning.
